resources.name: Lang-8
resources.description: Get your Japanese writing corrected by native speakers.
resources.descriptionLong: Lang-8 is a language exchange platform where you write journal entries in Japanese and native speakers correct them. In return, you correct entries in your native language. Great for improving writing skills with real feedback.
resources.notes: Currently not accepting new registrations. Try HiNative instead.

resources.name: HiNative
resources.description: Ask native speakers to check your Japanese writing.
resources.descriptionLong: HiNative lets you post Japanese writing samples and get feedback from native speakers. You can ask about grammar, word choice, and naturalness. A great alternative to Lang-8 for writing practice.
resources.priceDetails: Free tier available. Premium for additional features.
resources.notes: Active community for getting writing feedback.

resources.name: Kanji Study
resources.description: Practice writing kanji with stroke order guidance.
resources.descriptionLong: Kanji Study provides stroke order animations and writing practice for all joyo kanji. Practice writing characters on your device screen with feedback on stroke order and accuracy.
resources.priceDetails: Free with in-app purchases for full content
resources.notes: Best kanji writing practice app for Android.

resources.name: Skritter
resources.description: SRS-based kanji and kana writing practice.
resources.descriptionLong: Skritter combines spaced repetition with handwriting practice for Japanese characters. Write kanji and kana on your device and get instant feedback. The app tracks your progress and schedules reviews optimally.
resources.notes: Excellent for systematic character writing practice.

resources.name: Ringotan
resources.description: Kana writing practice app for beginners.
resources.descriptionLong: Ringotan is a beginner-friendly app for practicing hiragana and katakana writing. The app provides stroke order guidance and tracks your progress as you learn to write Japanese characters.
resources.notes: Good for beginners learning to write kana.

resources.name: Japanese Writing Practice Sheets
resources.nameJa: 日本語書き取り練習シート
resources.descriptionLong: Various websites offer free printable practice sheets for Japanese handwriting. These sheets include stroke order guides and practice grids for hiragana, katakana, and kanji.
resources.notes: Free printable resources for handwriting practice.

resources.name: italki Notebook
resources.description: Write entries and get corrections from the community.
resources.descriptionLong: italki's Notebook feature lets you write journal entries in Japanese and receive corrections from native speakers in the community. A good way to practice writing and get feedback.
resources.notes: Free writing correction from the italki community.

resources.name: Japanese Composition Resources
resources.description: Textbooks and guides for Japanese composition.
resources.descriptionLong: Various textbooks focus on Japanese composition and essay writing. These resources teach how to structure Japanese writing, use appropriate expressions, and write for different purposes.
resources.notes: Search for composition textbooks at your level.

resources.name: Takoboto Kanji Writing
resources.nameJa: タコボト漢字書き取り
resources.description: Kanji writing practice within the dictionary app.
resources.descriptionLong: Takoboto dictionary includes kanji writing practice with stroke order animations. Practice writing characters while looking up words, making it convenient for integrated study.
resources.notes: Writing practice integrated with dictionary lookups.

resources.name: Genkouyoushi Paper
resources.description: Traditional Japanese writing paper for practice.
resources.descriptionLong: Genkouyoushi is traditional Japanese manuscript paper with a grid format. Using this paper for writing practice helps develop proper character spacing and composition skills. Available as printable PDFs or physical notebooks.
resources.notes: Traditional format for Japanese writing practice.
